definition: white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: Frankly, it's gotten much easier these days.
sentences.chinese: 坦白講，目前它變得簡單多了。

sentences.english: Locals say both sides are not coming clean with the numbers.
sentences.chinese: 當地消息稱，雙方都未坦白交代自己的傷亡數字。

sentences.english: Honestly, this one looks a little ugly.
sentences.chinese: 坦白講，這個看起來有點醜。

sentences.english: If you cheated on your spouse, would you admit it to a researcher ?
sentences.chinese: 假如你對配偶不貞，會坦白告訴研究人員嗎？

sentences.english: Should you confess if you’ve had an affair?
sentences.chinese: 如果你曾經跟別人有曖昧關係，你是否應該坦白？

sentences.english: Well, one, it just starts to look ridiculous, frankly.
sentences.chinese: 第一，坦白的說，這開始看起來很荒謬。

sentences.english: I do not pretend to possess equal frankness with your ladyship.
sentences.chinese: 我並不冒充我也象你老人家一樣坦白。

sentences.english: The police caught him and he made a clean breast of his crime.
sentences.chinese: 警察抓住了他，他坦白交代了他的罪行。

sentences.english: And I didn`t know what to answer, how to betray, confess, parry.
sentences.chinese: 我不知回答什麼，不知怎樣背叛，坦白和逃避開。

sentences.english: Honestly, I play more pool nowadays then carom .
sentences.chinese: 坦白說，我發揮更大池如今，然後袋。

sentences.english: I must confess, I'm married and I'm Jewish.
sentences.chinese: 我必須坦白，我已經結婚且我是猶太人。

sentences.english: Speaking of which, I have something to confess.
sentences.chinese: 說到這個，我有一件事要跟你坦白。

sentences.english: Frankly speaking, I don 039; t think it any good to invest in realestate.
sentences.chinese: 坦白地說，我不覺得投資房地產有什麼好處。

sentences.english: But I'm not too interested in all this, to be honest.
sentences.chinese: 但是坦白說我對此並沒有多大的興趣。

sentences.english: Heart again to satisfying to hao tian to confess to identity, but are small excellent discouraged.
sentences.chinese: 心怡再次想向浩天坦白自己的身份，卻被小優勸阻。

sentences.english: He confessed his crime, and cast himself on the mercy of the court.
sentences.chinese: 他坦白了他的罪行，聽候法院處理。

definition: to conceal/to hide (a taboo subject)/to cover up the truth
to lay one's cards on the table
to give oneself up/to surrender (to the authorities)
lit. to put everything out including the tray/to reveal everything/to make a clean breast of it all
to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
to speak bluntly (idiom)/not to mince words
to hand over/to explain/to make clear/to brief (sb)/to account for/to justify oneself/to confess/(coll.) to finish
